column4: Hi. I'm trying to send a file via bluetooth to another computer. When I use the Send To nautilus extension, I don't get a list of devices to choose from. any ideas/
you do have teh device paired with the pc?
does it have to be paired? surely I can send to an arbitrary device, but the remote side has to accept it
err.. no - you normally have to pair bluetooth gizmos for them to send to each other.
otherwise all sorts of nasty things can start happening
btw, this worked fine under Karmic. Just not under Lucid
i recall some old bluetooth 'attacks' years back  when these things started getting common. Picture sitting on a buss and you get 20+ 'requests to accept' some spam/virus..
you need to pair to use specific devices (HID, or headsets etc)
sounds like somthuing that would make me want to not shop at that store
as it says, pairing is for use where you don't want user intervention in the connection
I still need bluez installed right?
no idea. bluetooth worked for me  from the initial install.  FIRST time bluetooth actuallh has worked for me on ubuntu
heh. I had to install various bits previously. This is an upgrade from Karmic, so there *may* be some muck left over from that
it does seem to be installed
